page.title: 16Buildings Babell Chapel
page.content: Babell Chapel was built in 1827 and became a memorial to Islwyn William Thomas,a famous poet,who lived from 1832 to 1878.His poetry was written in Welsh,his most famous poem was called "The Storm".Islwyn won four bardic chairs in the National Eisteddfod. He became linked to the chapel because he was the vicar.During the 1960's the chapel was vandalised and broken into. The Presbiterian Church of Wales bought the chapel for Â£10 and after spending Â£4000 the chapel was repainted and refurnished as a museum. It was opened by George Thomas,Speaker of the House of Commons.Now the chapel has a selection of paintings and information about the locality,some on display in glass cases about the 1935 "Stay Down Strike",the railway line, the sinking of the pit and Islwyn himself.
